about.title: Compost for Regenerative Agriculture
points: Made from natural agro-waste: biomass, cow dung, and cow urine.
Enriched with beneficial cultures like Trichoderma, Bio-NPK, and microbes.
Scientifically composted for full decomposition and high nutrient value.
Improves soil biology, texture, and supports stronger root development.
Outperforms vermicompost and raw dung in safety and effectiveness.

card1.title: Healthier Soil
card1.text: Increases organic matter and promotes beneficial microbes that enrich the soil, leading to long-term fertility and soil structure improvement.

card2.title: Better Water Retention
card2.text: Enhances the soil’s water-holding capacity by increasing humus content, making crops more resilient to dry spells and reducing irrigation needs.

card3.title: Stronger Crop Yields
card3.text: Improves root development and nutrient uptake, resulting in stronger plant growth, higher productivity, and better crop quality without chemical inputs.

card4.title: No Chemical Dependency
card4.text: Reduces reliance on synthetic fertilizers and pesticides, preventing long-term soil damage and keeping harmful residues out of your crops.

card5.title: Better Than Raw Cow Dung
card5.text: Unlike raw dung, our compost is fully decomposed, pathogen-free, odorless, and safe to handle—offering clean and reliable nourishment for your soil.

card6.title: Cost-Effective Farming
card6.text: Lowers overall farming expenses by reducing the need for external fertilizers and improving soil performance season after season.

usage.title: How Farmers Should Use Mahabal Engineering Compost
points: During soil preparation, mix 1–2 kg per square meter into the top 6–8 inches.
For existing crops, apply compost in a ring around the plant base.
Provides a steady, slow-release of nutrients over time.
Enriches the soil and reduces irrigation and chemical needs with regular use.
Avoid using raw cow dung directly—it can harm crops.

sustainable.title: Healthier Soil. Sustainable Farming. Better Future.
points: Improves soil organic matter (SOM) and natural fertility.
Boosts drought resistance through better water retention.
Reduces dependence on chemical fertilizers and pesticides.
Supports carbon sequestration by restoring humus in soil.
